Text.Page:
I followed your trail and that got me here safely. Judging by such a friendly reception, you must have accomplished quite a bit here already.

There's a rumor going around the camp that some strange ruins have been spotted nearby. I'm sure the sky cruiser isn't far from here!

We should take a short breather and then head for the sky cruiser.
Rhodos reports to you on the Khirian situation in Northern Arun. You help Rhodos to convince the Parthians, but you fail. (There was no improvement in sight.)
Paesyn wants to talk to you if you have a moment.

This is why I like you! You saved the day!

I've seen several pieces of Intrepid's wreckage. I'll check them over. Maybe impress Zolyn a bit. Get her to like me!

Since my poem didn't cheer her up, I drew a portrait of her. Could you deliver it? Please?
I heard you saved Madat. Not bad. You're a fine soldier.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"Paesyn drew this for you."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

I take it back.

Stop wasting my time with this nonsense. What is with that silly engineer? Doesn't he have work to do?
Have you seen where Paesyn went by any chance?<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"He's investigating the wreckage."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>
The way ahead will not be easy. You are new to Val Oriyn, so hear our grim tale.

We, the Khirians, resist the archdevas, but most of my kind are enslaved. We refer to them as the Parthia.

They have a camp nearby, but I don't know if they'll let us pass without a fight."I'll talk to them."

I hope diplomacy works for you.

Look for Pariya. The Parthia respect her, but be careful.

She's dangerous.

Hatishna? You believe such a popori tale?

No one stands against Lord Dakuryon. You too shall kneel before him!

Oh, ! You're here? Great!

Did Zolyn like the picture? I worked for days on it. What did she say?"She didn't care for it."
She probably doesn't appreciate my abstract realism. I studied art for two days in Velika, so I know all about it.
